key_points: Griddy Energy customers will not have to pay for the high electricity bills from February's winter storm due to a new settlement.
The settlement was announced by Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton.
The winter storm in February left millions of Texans without power and resulted in at least 210 deaths.
Texas Attorney General sued Griddy Energy for misleading advertising after customers received very high bills.
Griddy Energy offered a wholesale electricity rate, causing bills to skyrocket during the storm.
After the legal issues from the winter storm, Griddy Energy filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection.
The settlement releases former Griddy customers from any outstanding balances unless they opt out.
Former customers who paid their bills can seek reimbursement through bankruptcy court.
The settlement also prevents Griddy and its parent company from making misleading statements in their advertising.
Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton expressed satisfaction with the settlement and vowed to continue protecting Texans.
